page.title: 14THE SCHOOL TIMETABLE
page.content: After registration we sometimes have P.E. or sewing or other lessons of the timetable. This takes to afternoon break which lasts ten minutes. We continue our lessons until three forty five when the whistle blows to end the school day. Again the buses are available to take us home but I walk home and that takes ten to fifteen minutes. When I arrive home I wait until my mother arrives from work which is usually at four forty five p.m. I have my tea, then if it is not raining I go out and call for my friend Melanie Chamberlain and we play together until it is time to go home at about seven thirty p.m. I watch television then until ten thirty when I go to bed. By Leanne Arthur Aged 11.
